page.title: 08HONING ECOLOGICAL ISSUES
page.content: The Honing E.Ruston block contains a comparatively high percentage of land that is wood, tree and shrub covered. It has not been subjected to the widespread destruction and removal of hedgerows and coppices as have other parts of the county.There are tensions regarding conservation and the economic use of land. A plan by land agents wishing to maximise the sporting potential of the Honing estate to burn part of Crostwight Common in order to deprive vermin of cover caused an outcry - it is a habitat of the rare golden oriole. Also, should E.Ruston common remain a large tract of scrubland or be developed as a golf course, thus maximising income. And should the Nth. Walsham/Dilham canal be dredged to permit access to it by Broads hire fleet cruisers?
